alert.note: Alert for Blue Earth; Le Sueur; Nicollet; Scott; Sibley; Waseca (Minnesota) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued May 29 at 7:26AM CDT by NWS Minneapolis
info.description: ...A strong thunderstorm will impact portions of Le Sueur, southeastern Sibley, southwestern Scott, northern Blue Earth, northwestern Waseca and eastern Nicollet Counties through 800 AM CDT... At 726 AM CDT, trained weather spotters reported a strong thunderstorm over St. Peter, or 10 miles north of Mankato, moving northeast at 50 mph. HAZARD...Pea size hail. SOURCE...Trained weather spotters. IMPACT...Minor damage to outdoor objects is possible. This strong thunderstorm will be near... Cleveland around 735 AM CDT. Le Sueur and Le Center around 740 AM CDT. Henderson around 745 AM CDT. Other locations in the path of this storm include New Prague, Belle Plaine and Jordan. This includes the following highways... U.S. Highway 14 between mile markers 116 and 145. U.S. Highway 169 between mile markers 42 and 84. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.25 IN MAX WIND GUST...<30 MPH
info.instruction: Torrential rainfall is also occurring with this storm and may lead to localized flooding. Do not drive your vehicle through flooded roadways. This storm may intensify, so be certain to monitor local radio stations and available television stations for additional information and possible warnings from the National Weather Service. A Severe Thunderstorm Watch remains in effect until 100 PM CDT for south central, central and east central Minnesota.

area.areaDesc: Blue Earth; Le Sueur; Nicollet; Scott; Sibley; Waseca
